properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 11 at 2:50AM MST until January 12 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Great Falls MT
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow occurring. Total
snow accumulations of 2 to 8 inches, except up to one inch at
lower elevations. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the
Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow
accumulations of 6 to 14 inches, except 2 to 5 inches at lower
elevations possible. Blowing snow possible throughout the
period.

* WHERE...Southern Rocky Mountain Front.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 AM MST Sunday.
For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday morning through Monday
afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas
of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The
dangerously cold wind chills as low as 35 below zero could
cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on
young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local
Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST SUNDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON
